newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Dead Belgian sex victim girls to be buried apart.
newsitem.headline: Dead Belgian sex victim girls to be buried apart.

text.p: The bodies of two young girl victims of a Belgian kidnapping and sexual abuse gang, found under a shed on a property belonging to the chief suspect, will be buried separately here in their home town on Saturday.

Eefje Lambrecks will be buried after a service at 1030 local (0830 GMT) in Banneux Church in Hasselt, eastern Belgium. Her friend An Marchal will be buried after a service at 1400 local (1200 GMT) in Hasselt Cathedral, a city official told Reuters.

The bodies of the girls were found on Tuesday in a metal container 2.5 metres (yards) beneath a shed on the grounds of a house in the city of Charleroi belonging to convicted child rapist Marc Dutroux, who admits kidnapping them in August 1995.
The house was formerly occupied by frenchman Bernard Weinstein, an accomplice whom Dutroux admits killing and who he accuses of murdering An and Eefje.

The parents of the two girls fell out some while ago over the decision of one to sell postcard-sized pictures of them with requests for leads in order to raise money to hire a private detective to pick up where the police had evidently left off.

Belgium has been in shock and mourning since August 15 when two girls were rescued from a makeshift dungeon in another house owned by Dutroux in Charleroi, and two more were found dead from starvation two days later in a Dutroux house south west of the city.
